result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micah James HAMMOND

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in both counts.  The defendant plead to charges of retail theft, theft and bail jumping in 14 CM 41 and 13 CM 595.  Motion granted.
Minutes.
Plea date is set for 04-06-15 at 10:30 a.m.
Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-28-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Plea date is set for 01-29-15 at 10:00 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-24-14 at 8:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 09-15-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond witht he conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Wisconsin Aluminum Foundry, Defaut Auto and Kyle Peterson.  Bail furnished.

RE:  Bail jumping, on 07-02-14.
Initial appearance is set for 09-08-14 at 2:30 p.m.
